thrust::system::omp Namespace Reference
Systems

thrust::system::omp is the namespace containing functionality for allocating, manipulating, and deallocating memory available to Thrust's OpenMP backend system. The identifiers are provided in a separate namespace underneath thrust::system for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust::omp namespace for easy access. More...

Detailed Description

thrust::system::omp is the namespace containing functionality for allocating, manipulating, and deallocating memory available to Thrust's OpenMP backend system. The identifiers are provided in a separate namespace underneath thrust::system for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust::omp namespace for easy access.

Function Documentation

void thrust::system::omp::free ( pointer< void >  ptr) [inline]

Deallocates an area of memory previously allocated by omp::malloc.

Parameters:
ptrA omp::pointer<void> pointing to the beginning of an area of memory previously allocated with omp::malloc.
See also:
omp::malloc
std::free
pointer<void> thrust::system::omp::malloc ( std::size_t  n) [inline]

Allocates an area of memory available to Thrust's omp system.

Parameters:
nNumber of bytes to allocate.
Returns:
A omp::pointer<void> pointing to the beginning of the newly allocated memory. A null omp::pointer<void> is returned if an error occurs.
Note:
The omp::pointer<void> returned by this function must be deallocated with omp::free.
See also:
omp::free
std::malloc

reference< T >  y 
)

Exchanges the values of two objects referred to by reference. x The first reference of interest. y The second reference ot interest.
